At that time, the Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:

Are the designations of dharmas such as form not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?

Are the designations of form and so forth as permanent or impermanent, as blissful or painful, as self or not self, as pure or impure, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having wishes or having no wishes, as calm or not calm, as isolated or not isolated, as defiled or undefiled, as arising or ceasing, also not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-honored One!
Form and so forth are ultimately non-existent, because their nature does not exist. How much more so for the designations of form and so forth!
Since these designations do not exist, how can one say that the designations of form and so forth are a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
World-honored One!

Form and other dharmas are ultimately non-apprehensible because their nature does not exist. How could there be impermanence of form and other dharmas?ğŸ”½Permanence and impermanence of form and other dharmas are ultimately non-apprehensible, so how could there be a designation of permanence and impermanence of form and other dharmas?

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they do not see any dharmas at all. Because they do not see, their minds are not startled, frightened, or terrified. Their minds do not become depressed or regretful about any dharmas.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ like this, they do not see form, do not see feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness;
they do not see the eye-base, do not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind-base;
they do not see the form-base, do not see the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma-base;
They do not see the eye element, nor do they see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind element;
They do not see the form element, nor do they see the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma element;
They do not see the eye consciousness element, nor do they see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness element;
They do not see the earth element, nor do they see the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness element;
They do not see ignorance, nor do they see volitional actions, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death;
They do not see desire, nor do they see anger or ignorance;

They do not see a self, nor do they see a sentient being, a living being, one born, one nourished, a person, an individual, one who is born from mind, a youth, one who does, one who feels, one who knows, or one who sees;
They do not see the desire realm, nor do they see the form or formless realm;

They do not see Å›rÄvakas and the teachings of Å›rÄvakas, they do not see pratyekabuddhas and the teachings of pratyekabuddhas, they do not see bodhisattvas and the teachings of bodhisattvas, they do not see buddhas and the teachings of buddhas, they do not see unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
Thus, SubhÅ«ti!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see anything at all among all dharmas. Because they do not see, their minds are not startled, frightened, or terrified. Their minds do not sink or become regretful with regard to all dharmas.

The Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they do not apprehend or see any mental factors or mental activities at all. For this reason, their minds are not submerged in, nor do they regret, any phenomena.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, at all times and in all places, they do not obtain prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, nor do they obtain the name 'prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ';

Chapter on Entering the Unborn, Second Part, Chapter 7 on Entering the Unborn At that time, Subhuti the Elder said to the Buddha:

If you wish to perfect the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, you should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly know feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly know the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly know the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly understand the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly understand ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly understand the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

if they wish to thoroughly understand karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.ğŸ”½If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to permanently eliminate desire, anger, and ignorance, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to permanently eliminate attachment to form, attachment to the formless, ignorance, pride, and agitation, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to permanently eliminate all latent tendencies and entanglements, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to permanently eliminate the four kinds of food, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to permanently eliminate the four floods, yokes, clingings, bodily fetters, and inverted views, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.ğŸ”½If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to be far removed from the ten unwholesome courses of action, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to practice the ten wholesome courses of action, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to cultivate the four concentrations, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ;
If they wish to cultivate the four immeasurables and the four formless concentrations, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ;

if they wish to cultivate the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to attain the ten powers of a buddha, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ;

if they wish to attain the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to freely enter the samÄdhi of the factors of enlightenment, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to enter and exit the samÄdhi of powerful conduct, the samÄdhi of precious seal,ğŸ”½the samÄdhi of the wonderful moon, the samÄdhi of the moon's banner-mark, the samÄdhi of the seal of all dharmas,

the samÄdhi of observing the seal, the samÄdhi of the determination of the dharma realm, the samÄdhi of the determination-banner-mark, the vajra-like samÄdhi, the samÄdhi of entering all dharma gates,

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to fulfill the wishes of all beings, they should master prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.ğŸ”½Here is the text with the alignment mistakes fixed and the English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to fulfill such excellent roots of goodness, and by means of these roots of goodness to attain perfect completion, not to fall into the evil destinies, not to be born in poor and lowly families, not to fall into the stages of Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and never to retrogress from the peak of the bodhisattvas, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
What is called the retrogressing from the peak of the bodhisattvas?
SubhÅ«ti replied:

If bodhisattvas, without skillful means, practice the six perfections, and without skillful means abide in the three doors of liberation, they retrogress to the stage of Å›rÄvakas or pratyekabuddhas, and do not enter the bodhisattvas' correct detachment from birth. This is called the retrogressing from the peak of the bodhisattvas.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
What is called birth?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
Birth refers to the love of dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra said:
What is called the love of dharmas?
SubhÅ«ti replied:

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, abiding in the emptiness of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the emptiness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;ğŸ”½abiding in the signlessness of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the signlessness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;

abiding in the wishlessness of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the wishlessness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;
abiding in the quiescence of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the quiescence of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;
abiding in the isolation of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the isolation of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;

abiding in the impermanence of form and giving rise to conceptual attachment, abiding in the impermanence of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness and giving rise to conceptual attachment;

Abiding in the suffering of form, they give rise to conceptual attachments; abiding in the suffering of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, they give rise to conceptual attachments;ğŸ”½Abiding in the selflessness of form, they give rise to conceptual attachments; abiding in the selflessness of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, they give rise to conceptual attachments;

Abiding in the impurity of form, they give rise to conceptual attachments; abiding in the impurity of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, they give rise to conceptual attachments.
ÅšÄriputra!
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's following the love of the Dharma, and this love of the Dharma is called birth.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thinks like this:
'This form should be eliminated, this feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness should be eliminated;
Because of this, form should be eliminated, because of this, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness should be eliminated.
This suffering should be fully known, because of this, suffering should be fully known;
This accumulation should be permanently eliminated, because of this, accumulation should be permanently eliminated;
This cessation should be realized, because of this cessation should be realized;
This path should be cultivated, because of this path should be cultivated.
This is defilement, this is purity;ğŸ”½This should be closely attended to, this should not be closely attended to;
This should be practiced, this should not be practiced;
This is the path, this is not the path;
This should be learned, this should not be learned.
This is the perfection of generosity, this is not the perfection of generosity;
This is the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom, this is not the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.
This is skillful means, this is not skillful means;
This is the birth of a bodhisattva, this is the detachment from birth of a bodhisattva.'
ÅšÄriputra!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, abide in these various Dharma gates and give rise to attachment, this is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas' compliance with the love of dharmas. This love of dharmas is called birth, like the birth of leftover food that can cause harm.
At that time, the venerable ÅšÄriputra asked the venerable SubhÅ«ti, saying:
How do bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas enter the correct nature of detachment from birth?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
ÅšÄriputra!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, do not see internal emptiness and do not rely on internal emptiness to contemplate external emptiness;ğŸ”½do not see external emptiness and do not rely on external emptiness to contemplate internal emptiness, and do not rely on external emptiness to contemplate internal and external emptiness;

do not see internal and external emptiness and do not rely on internal and external emptiness to contemplate external emptiness, and do not rely on internal and external emptiness to contemplate the emptiness of emptiness;
They do not see emptiness of emptiness, do not rely on emptiness of emptiness to contemplate internal and external emptiness, do not rely on emptiness of emptiness to contemplate great emptiness;
They do not see great emptiness, do not rely on great emptiness to contemplate emptiness of emptiness, do not rely on great emptiness to contemplate emptiness of ultimate reality;

They do not see emptiness of ultimate reality, do not rely on emptiness of ultimate reality to contemplate great emptiness, do not rely on emptiness of ultimate reality to contemplate emptiness of conditioned phenomena;

They do not see emptiness of conditioned phenomena, do not rely on emptiness of conditioned phenomena to contemplate emptiness of ultimate reality, do not rely on emptiness of conditioned phenomena to contemplate emptiness of unconditioned phenomena;ğŸ”½They do not see emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, do not rely on emptiness of unconditioned phenomena to contemplate emptiness of conditioned phenomena, do not rely on emptiness of unconditioned phenomena to contemplate emptiness of the ultimate;ğŸ”½They do not see emptiness of the ultimate, do not rely on emptiness of the ultimate to contemplate emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, do not rely on emptiness of the ultimate to contemplate emptiness of the beginningless and endless;

They do not see emptiness of the beginningless and endless, do not rely on emptiness of the beginningless and endless to contemplate emptiness of the ultimate, do not rely on emptiness of the beginningless and endless to contemplate emptiness of dispersion and non-dispersion;

They do not see the emptiness of dispersion and nondispersal, and do not rely on the emptiness of dispersion and nondispersal to contemplate the emptiness of the limitless; they do not rely on the emptiness of dispersion and nondispersal to contemplate the emptiness of inherent nature;

They do not see the emptiness of inherent nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of inherent nature to contemplate the emptiness of dispersion and nondispersal, and do not rely on the emptiness of inherent nature to contemplate the emptiness of specific and general characteristics;

They do not see the emptiness of specific and general characteristics, and do not rely on the emptiness of specific and general characteristics to contemplate the emptiness of inherent nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of specific and general characteristics to contemplate the emptiness of all dharmas;

They do not see the emptiness of all dharmas, and do not rely on the emptiness of all dharmas to contemplate the emptiness of specific and general characteristics, and do not rely on the emptiness of all dharmas to contemplate the emptiness of non-acquisition;

They do not see the emptiness of non-acquisition, and do not rely on the emptiness of non-acquisition to contemplate the emptiness of all dharmas, and do not rely on the emptiness of non-acquisition to contemplate the emptiness of nature;

They do not see the emptiness of nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of nature to contemplate the emptiness of non-acquisition, and do not rely on the emptiness of nature to contemplate the emptiness of self-nature;

They do not see the emptiness of intrinsic nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of intrinsic nature to contemplate the emptiness of nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of intrinsic nature to contemplate the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-nature;
They do not see the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-nature, and do not rely on the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-nature to contemplate the emptiness of intrinsic nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
When these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in this way, it is called entering the bodhisattva's correct detachment from birth.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they should study in this way:
One should know that form should not be grasped as it really is, and one should know that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness should not be grasped as they really are;
One should know that the eye sense base should not be grasped as it really is, and one should know that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases should not be grasped as they really are;

One should know that the form sense base should not be grasped as it really is, and one should know that the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases should not be grasped as they really are;
One should know that the eye element should not be grasped at, and one should know that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind elements should not be grasped at;
One should know that the form element should not be grasped at, and one should know that the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma elements should not be grasped at;
One should know that the eye consciousness element should not be grasped at, and one should know that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness elements should not be grasped at;
One should know that the perfection of giving should not be grasped at, and one should know that the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom should not be grasped at;
One should know that the four concentrations should not be grasped at, and one should know that the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations should not be grasped at;

One should know that the four establishments of mindfulness should not be grasped at, and one should know that the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path should not be grasped at;

One should not grasp at the knowledge of the ten powers of the Buddha as it really is, and one should not grasp at the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha as they really are.
Thus, ÅšÄriputra!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they are able to know that the mind of enlightenment should not be grasped, the mind of equality should not be grasped, and the vast mind should not be grasped.
Why is it so?
ÅšÄriputra!
This mind is originally pure because of its inherent nature.
Then ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
What is the original purity of this mind?
SubhÅ«ti replied:

The fundamental nature of this mind is neither associated with nor dissociated from greed, neither associated with nor dissociated from anger, neither associated with nor dissociated from delusion, neither associated with nor dissociated from the entanglements, bonds, and latent tendencies, neither associated with nor dissociated from the various views and defilements, and neither associated with nor dissociated from the minds of the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.
ÅšÄriputra!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas know the mind to be of such a fundamentally pure nature.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
Is there a non-mind nature in this mind?
SubhÅ«ti asked in return:
Can the nature of existence or non-existence be attained within the non-mind nature?
ÅšÄriputra said:
No, it is not.ğŸ”½
SubhÅ«ti!
SubhÅ«ti replied:
If the nature of existence or non-existence within the non-mind nature cannot be attained, how can it be asked whether there is a non-mind nature in this mind?
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti,
What is called the non-mind nature?
SubhÅ«ti replied,
The non-differentiation and non-discrimination of all dharmas is called the non-mind nature.
ÅšÄriputra said,
Is it only the mind that is non-differentiating and non-discriminating, or are form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness also non-differentiating and non-discriminating?
SubhÅ«ti replied,

Just as the mind is non-differentiating and non-discriminating, so are form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness also non-differentiating and non-discriminating. In the same way, even the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas is also non-differentiating and non-discriminating.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra praised SubhÅ«ti, saying,ğŸ”½Excellent!
Excellent!
It is just as you have said.

You are truly the Buddha's son, born from the Buddha's heart, born from the Buddha's mouth, born from the Buddha's Dharma, born from the Dharma's transformation, receiving the Buddha's Dharma portion, not receiving the material portion, personally realizing in your own body the truths of the various dharmas, able to expound them with the wisdom eye.
The Buddha always says that among the Buddha's disciples, you are foremost in abiding in the concentration of no contention. As the Buddha says, it is true and not false.
SubhÅ«ti!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should study the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ like this.
SubhÅ«ti!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to study the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ like this, you should know that they have already abided in the stage of nonretrogression and are not apart from prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
SubhÅ«ti!

If good men and good women wish to study the stage of the Å›rÄvakas, they should diligently listen to, study, recite, uphold, and contemplate this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with the principles, and bring it to completion;ğŸ”½if they wish to study the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, they should also diligently listen to, study, recite, uphold, and contemplate this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with the principles, and bring it to completion;

if they wish to study the stage of the bodhisattvas, they should also diligently listen to, study, recite, uphold, and contemplate this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with the principles, and bring it to completion.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
Because this profound sÅ«tra of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ extensively explains and reveals the teachings of the Three Vehicles.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, then they will be studying the teachings of the Three Vehicles everywhere and will attain skillfulness in all of them.
Chapter 8: The Victorious Army, Part 2, Chapter 8: The Victorious Army, Part 1 At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain anything regarding the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva or prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. How can you have me teach the Dharma in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ to instruct and teach the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
World-Honored One!
If I were to instruct and teach the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas using dharmas, I would have regret.
World-Honored One!
If I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of dharmas, how can I say:
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and this is called prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ?
World-Honored One!
The names of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and the name prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because these two kinds of meanings do not exist, these two kinds of names have no abode whatsoever and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of form up to consciousness. How can it be said that this is form up to consciousness?
These names of form and so forth have no abode whatsoever and are also not without abode.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of form and so forth does not exist, these names of form and so forth have no abode whatsoever and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the eye faculty up to the mind faculty. How can it be said that this is the eye faculty up to the mind faculty?
The names of the eye faculty and so forth have no abode whatsoever and are also not without abode.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the eye faculty and so forth does not exist, the names of the eye faculty and so forth have no abode whatsoever and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the form realm up to the dharma realm, how can I say this is the form realm up to the dharma realm?
The names of the form realm, etc. all abide nowhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the form realm, etc. does not exist, the names of the form realm, etc. all abide nowhere and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the eye realm up to the mind realm, how can I say this is the eye realm up to the mind realm?
The names of the eye realm, etc. all abide nowhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the eye realm, etc. does not exist, the names of the eye realm, etc. all abide nowhere and are also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the form realm up to the dharma realm, how can I say this is the form realm up to the dharma realm?
The names of the form realm and so forth have no abode and are also not without abode.
Why is this?
Because the meaning of the form realm and so forth does not exist, the names of the form realm and so forth have no abode and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the eye consciousness realm up to the mental consciousness realm, how can it be said that this is the eye consciousness realm up to the mental consciousness realm?
The names of the eye consciousness realm and so forth have no abode and are also not without abode.
Why is this?
Because the meaning of the eye consciousness realm and so forth does not exist, the names of the eye consciousness realm and so forth have no abode and are also not without abode.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of eye contact up to mental contact, how can it be said that this is eye contact up to mental contact?
The names of eye contact and so forth have no abode and are also not without abode.
Why is this?
Because the meaning of eye contact and so forth is non-existent, the names eye contact and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also do not not abide.
World-Honored One!

If I do not know and do not attain the increase or decrease of the various feelings produced from the condition of eye contact up to the various feelings produced from the condition of mind contact, how can I speak of this as the various feelings produced from the condition of eye contact up to the various feelings produced from the condition of mind contact?
The names of the various feelings produced from the condition of eye contact and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also do not not abide.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the various feelings produced from the condition of eye contact and so forth is non-existent, the names of the various feelings produced from the condition of eye contact and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also do not not abide.
World-Honored One!
If I do not know and do not attain the increase or decrease of ignorance up to old age and death, how can I speak of this as ignorance up to old age and death?
The names of ignorance and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also do not not abide.
Why is it so?
Because the meanings of ignorance and so forth do not exist, the names 'ignorance' and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also are not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the cessation of old age and death up to the cessation of ignorance. How can it be said that this is the cessation of old age and death up to the cessation of ignorance?
The names of the cessation of ignorance and so forth all have no abode whatsoever, and also are not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meanings of the cessation of ignorance and so forth do not exist, the names 'cessation of ignorance' and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also are not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of greed, hatred, delusion, entanglements, bonds, latent tendencies, and views. How can it be said that these are greed and so forth?
These names of greed and so forth all have no abode whatsoever, and also are not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meanings of greed and so forth do not exist, these names of greed and so forth have no abode whatsoever, and also are not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the perfections of giving, up to wisdom. How can I say this is the perfection of giving, up to wisdom?
The names of the perfections of giving and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not not abide.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the perfections of giving and so forth does not exist, the names of the perfections of giving and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not not abide.
World-Honored One!
I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of self, up to the seer. How can I say this is self, up to the seer?
The names of self and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not not abide.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of self and so forth does not exist, the names of self and so forth do not abide anywhere, nor do they not not abide.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path. How can I say this is the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path?
The names of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?

Because the meaning of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth is non-existent, the names of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the emptiness liberation gate up to the wishless liberation gate. How can I say this is the emptiness liberation gate up to the wishless liberation gate?
The names of the emptiness liberation gate and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the emptiness liberation gate and so forth is non-existent, the names of the emptiness liberation gate and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of the four meditations, four immeasurable [minds], and four formless concentrations. How can I say these are the four meditations, four immeasurable [minds], and four formless concentrations?
The names of the four meditations and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of the four meditations and so forth is non-existent, the names of the four meditations and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not know or obtain the increase or decrease of mindfulness of the Buddha, mindfulness of the Dharma, mindfulness of the Saá¹…gha, mindfulness of precepts, mindfulness of giving, mindfulness of heaven, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and mindfulness of death. How can I say these are mindfulness of the Buddha up to mindfulness of death?
The names of mindfulness of the Buddha and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
Why is it so?
Because the meaning of mindfulness of the Buddha and so forth is non-existent, the names of mindfulness of the Buddha and so forth are all without abiding and also not non-abiding.
World-Honored One!

I do not understand or attain the increase or decrease of the Buddha's ten powers up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, so how can I say these are the Buddha's ten powers up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha?
The names of the Buddha's ten powers and so forth do not abide anywhere and are also not non-abiding.
Why is this?
